title: PTT Exploration & Production 3Q Net Profit Up 14% on Year
text:
By Ben Otto

PTT Exploration & Production PCL (PTTEP.TH) posted a 14% on-year rise in net profit in the third quarter, helped by asset acquisition in Malaysia and greater contributions from operations in Australia and Thailand.

The state-controlled company, a subsidiary of Thai oil-and-gas conglomerate PTT PCL (PTT.TH), booked net profit of about $358 million, up from around $315 million in the same period a year earlier. An increase in average sales volume more than offset higher exploration expenses, income taxes and administrative expenses, the company said Wednesday.

Sales revenue in the period rose 12% to $1.49 billion, it said.

PTTEP raised its sales estimates for 2019 to about 345,000 barrels of oil equivalent a day, primarily on the acquisition of Malaysian assets. It expects Dubai crude-oil prices to average $60-$65 a barrel in 2019, with likely higher U.S. crude supply offsetting lower production in OPEC countries.

PTTEP has more than 40 projects in a dozen countries, with the bulk of its profits coming from operations in Thailand.

Write to Ben Otto at ben.otto@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 30, 2019 05:29 ET (09:29 GMT)
